attributes.title: Physical stock taking
attributes.description: A stock take exercise was conducted on 11th Feb 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.
attributes.recommendation: Stock controls are effective and need to be maintained.

value: We will maintain the trend
We will maintain the trend
A shortfall of in white flour 125kg was reported in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Bread weight check
attributes.description:
Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

Both sample varieties had few cases of underweight.
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be maintained.

value: We will continue making improvements
More control measures will be initiated.
Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.

attributes.title: Mixing chart Analysis
attributes.description: Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 09.01.25 – 10.02.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.

value: We will maintain
To be maintained
No variances were reported in the previous audit findings

attributes.title: Cash Verification

value: We will maintain the trend

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description:
The average production efficiency was analyzed from 9th Jan 2025 to 10th Feb 2025 to determine if the planned production cost was observed.

·        The branch hired a total of 371 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 1,670 bags.

·        The actual production was 1,719 bags leading to an actual efficiency of 4.6 bags per worker.

·        The set efficiency was achieved

The table below summarize the findings

attributes.title: Packaging efficiency
attributes.description:
The branch average packaging efficiency from 9th Jan to 10th Feb 2025 was analyzed to determine if the planned cost of production was attained.

·        The total bread produced over the audited period is 22,461 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 232 workers.

          A total of 236 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 95.2 crates per worker which is slightly below the set efficiency.

          Extra 4 packers were hired over the audit period and the set packaging efficiency was not achieved. The extra packaging cost incurred amounted to Ksh. 3,648.

            The table below summarized the findings
attributes.recommendation: The management to ensure that the set packaging efficiency is consistently attained.

value: The drop in efficiency was contributed by frequent shift-cuts
We will initiate corrective measures to ensure that the set efficiency is attained.

attributes.title: Damages analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis of bread damages from 09.01.25 – 10.02.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 1.5% of the total sales. 


A total of 391.4 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.12% of the total loaves produced.


5,654.75 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 1.45% of the total sales over the audited period.


Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit.

Below is a summary details of the findings

value: The positive trend will be maintained
To be maintained
Damages were maintained within the set limits in the previous audit findings
Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.
Operations/Production Department
